description: Borrowed from French déporter. With the meaning of "behave", from Old French deporter (“behave”), from Latin deportō, from de- + portō.

verbs.description: deport (third-person singular simple present deports, present participle deporting, simple past and past participle deported)

entries.meaning: (reflexive, now rare) To comport (oneself); to behave.
(transitive) To evict, especially from a country.
